pGUI.core

Class Control

  • java.lang.Object
    • pGUI.core.Control
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Button, Checkbox, Container, Label, ListItem, MenuItem, Slider

    public abstract class Control
extends java.lang.Object
    (Abstract) Base class for all other visual components. It provides all basic style attributes and methods. It also comes with the essential event handling and some rendering methods.

      • forceRenderAlthoughItShouldntBeNeeded

        public void forceRenderAlthoughItShouldntBeNeeded()
        Force a re-render of this Component. This shouldn't be needed, but just in case

      • focus

        public void focus()
        Request the Frame Component to focus this object. The Frame decides upon the demand and can set this Components focused-state to true. There can only be one focused element at a time and it is stored in the Frames property
        See Also:
        focusedElement.

      • blur

        public void blur()
        Request the Frame Component to blur this object(set focus to false).
        See Also:
        focusedElement.

      • addAutoAnchor

        public void addAutoAnchor(int... newAnchors)
        Add an anchor (types are TOP, RIGHT, BOTTOM, LEFT). Anchors ensure the Component stays at fixed relative positions when the parent is resized. If opposite anchors are set, the Component will be resized as well. When this function is called the Component will remember the CURRENT(!) distances to the parents bounds. Multiple anchors can be set with this method.
        Parameters:
        newAnchors - accepts TOP, RIGHT, LEFT or BOTTOM. Pass up to four anchor types (order doesn't matter)

      • removeAnchor

        public void removeAnchor(int anchorType)
        Remove a set anchor.
        Parameters:
        anchorType - accepts TOP, RIGHT, LEFT or BOTTOM

      • setX

        public void setX(int x)
        Set x-coordinate of Component relative to parent. Does not apply if Component is added to a FlowContainer.
        Parameters:
        x - pixel integer

      • setY

        public void setY(int y)
        Set y-coordinate of Component relative to parent. Does not apply if Component is added to a FlowContainer.
        Parameters:
        y - pixel integer

      • setZ

        public void setZ(int z)
        Set z-coordinate of Component. Components are sorted by z-index when overlapping on the screen.
        Parameters:
        z - z-index

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(int x,
                        int y)
        Set Location relative to parent.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate
        y - y-coordinate

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Set width of Component in pixel.
        Parameters:
        width - width in pixel

      • setMinWidth

        public void setMinWidth(int minWidth)
        Set minimum width of Component in pixel. Width of Component will never be less than minWidth. minWidth cannot be smaller than 1.
        Parameters:
        minWidth - minimum width in pixel

      • setMaxWidth

        public void setMaxWidth(int maxWidth)
        Set maximum width of Component in pixel. Width of Component will never be greater than maxWidth. Default is 100000.
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - maximum width in pixel

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(int height)
        Set height of Component in pixel.
        Parameters:
        height - height in pixel

      • setMinHeight

        public void setMinHeight(int minHeight)
        Set minimum height of Component in pixel. Width of Component will never be less than minHeight. minHeight cannot be smaller than 1.
        Parameters:
        minHeight - minimum height in pixel

      • setMaxHeight

        public void setMaxHeight(int maxHeight)
        Set maximum height of Component in pixel. Width of Component will never be greater than maxHeight. Default is 100000.
        Parameters:
        maxHeight - maximum height in pixel

        public void setBackgroundColor(int clr)
        Set the plain background color of the Component. Actual displayed color can vary if the Component is i.e. hovered over.
        Parameters:
        clr - integer rgb color

        public void setBorderRadius(int borderRadius)
        Rounds the corners of the Component. Negative values will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        borderRadius - border radius

      • setText

        public void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Set the text content. Some Components do not display any text (i.e. most Containers).
        Parameters:
        text - text

      • setFontSize

        public void setFontSize(int fontSize)

      • setTextAlign

        public void setTextAlign(int align)
        Set the text align (works for most Components).
        Parameters:
        align - LEFT, CENTER, RIGHT

      • setTextAlignY

        public void setTextAlignY(int align)
        Vertical align (not implemented in all Components).
        Parameters:
        align - TOP, MIDDLE, BOTTOM

      • setCursor

        public void setCursor(int cursor)
        Set the cursor displayed when mouse is over this Component.
        Parameters:
        cursor - Integer between 0 and 11. Can use constants like ARROW, CROSS, HAND, MOVE, TEXT, or WAIT.

      • setImage

        public void setImage(PImage image)
        Set the (background) image of the Component. This is not implemented in all but in most Components. The image is copied!
        Parameters:
        image - PImage or PGraphics object.

      • setImageMode

        public void setImageMode(int imageMode)
        Set the image filling mode. @see FILL @see FIT @see FIT_INSIDE
        Parameters:
        imageMode. - Use Control.FILL, Control.FIT or Control.FIT_INSIDE

      • setGradient

        public void setGradient(int clr1,
                        int clr2)
        Set background to a vertical gradient between the two given colros. This removes the background image if set.
        Parameters:
        clr1 - top color
        clr2 - bottom color

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Set the enabled state of this Component. If false it will not receive any events and be displayed in a different (mostly greyish) way.
        Parameters:
        enabled - enabled state

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
        Set the visibility. Invisible Components will not be rendered and receive not events.
        Parameters:
        visible - visibility state

      • setOpacity

        public void setOpacity(float opacity)
        Set opacity (opposite of transparency).
        Parameters:
        opacity - opacity from 0 (transparent) to 1 (opaque).

      • setMargin

        public void setMargin(int all)
        Apply margins to all sides of the Component. In FlowContainers and similar containers neighboring Components this determines the distance to neighbor Components and the parents bounds.
        Parameters:
        all - margin in pixel

      • setMargin

        public void setMargin(int top_bottom,
                      int left_right)
        Apply same margins to both top/bottom and left/right.
        Parameters:
        top_bottom - top and bottom margin
        left_right - left and right margin

      • setMargin

        public void setMargin(int top,
                      int right,
                      int bottom,
                      int left)
        Set individual top, right, bottom and left margins.
        Parameters:
        top - top margin in pixel
        right - right margin in pixel
        bottom - bottom margin in pixel
        left - left margin in pixel

      • setPadding

        public void setPadding(int top,
                       int right,
                       int bottom,
                       int left)
        Apply individual padding to all sides of the Component. Padding will create space inside the Component between borders and content.
        Parameters:
        top - top padding in pixel
        right - right padding in pixel
        bottom - bottom padding in pixel
        left - left padding in pixel

      • animate

        public void animate(java.lang.String attribute,
                    float aimedValue,
                    double milliseconds)
        Create a transition animation for a property of this Component. The @link Frame will deal with changing this property in appropriate steps to create the effect.
        Parameters:
        attribute - name of attribute to animate
        aimedValue - final value for the attribute
        milliseconds - time for animation in milliseconds

      • addMouseListener

        public boolean addMouseListener(java.lang.String type,
                                java.lang.String methodName)
        Adds a mouse listener. The type can be "press", "release", "enter", "exit, "move", "drag" and "wheel". Each Component allows one listener per type. The given method can be implemented without arguments or with MouseEvent as parameter. If it is defined in another class than in the main PApplet scope use the overloaded method addMouseListener(String, String, Object) that allows passing a target object.
        Parameters:
        type - String for event type
        methodName - Name of method to invoke
        Returns:
        false if type is invalid, method is not accessible or a listener has already been registered for this type. Returns true if successful.

      • addMouseListener

        public boolean addMouseListener(java.lang.String type,
                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Object target)
        Parameters:
        type - String for event type
        methodName - name of callback method
        target - Object where the callback method is declared.
        Returns:
        false if type is invalid, method is not accessible or a listener has already been registered for this type. Returns true if successful.
        See Also:
        Allows to pass a target object where the given method is declared.

      • removeMouseListener

        public void removeMouseListener(java.lang.String type)
        Remove a mouse listener for given type if one has already been set up.
        Parameters:
        type - event type.

      • addResizeListener

        public void addResizeListener(java.lang.String methodName,
                              java.lang.Object target)
        Add a resize listener that fires each time the Component is resized by anchor resizing. Event arguments: null
        Parameters:
        methodName - name of callback method
        target - Object where the callback method is declared.

      • addFocusListener

        public void addFocusListener(java.lang.String methodName,
                             java.lang.Object target)
        Add a focus listener that fires when the Component gets focus (through mouse click, programmatically, ...). Event arguments: null
        Parameters:
        methodName - name of callback method
        target - Object where the callback method is declared.

      • addResizeListener

        public void addResizeListener(java.lang.String methodName)
        Parameters:
        methodName - method to call.
        See Also:
        , target is the PApplet sketch
